title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.2: DRR & CLIMATE RESILIENCE POLICIES AND PROGRAMMES

description.narrative: Output 4.2 DRR & Climate resilience policies. Regional, sub-regional and national stakeholders have the evidence, and increased capacity to develop and implement multi-sectorial DRR and climate resilience policies and programmes., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 0843-03045 Panama Republica de Panama

sector.narrative: Climate change/environmental education, awareness and advocacy
Risk assessment and analysis (including conflict, disaster, climate, epidemics)
Risk informed Programming for resilience (including policy and strategy development)
Risk management and resilience/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.2 DRR & Climate resilience policies. Regional, sub-regional and national stakeholders have the evidence, and increasedcapacity to develop and implement multi-sectorial DRR and climate resilience policies and programmes.

description.narrative: Technical assistance and guidance have been provided to COs, governments and partners in LAC to strengthen their capacities to develop and implement multi-sectorial disaster risk reduction and climate actions, though evidence generation, advocacy for child inclusive policies and climate and risk informed programming. | Status:Met | As-of Date:04/03/2022
